description.narrative: Modernization of Sustainability and Efficiency of ICT infrastructure and ICT services in the Republic of Azerbaijan

activity-description.narrative: to extend the reach of the Information and Communication Technologies with a view to increase efficiency of the public sector institutions
to extend the reach of the Information and Communication Technologies with a view to increase efficiency of the public sector institutions
to extend the reach of the Information and Communication Technologies with a view to increase efficiency of the public sector institutions

description.narrative: 1) Secretariat is established 2) All event info is ready 3) Event is organized 4) Platform is operational 5) High Technologies via Artificial Intelligence, Cloud Technologies, Robopark initiative and human capital by envisioning potential opportunities 6) National Strategy on High Technologies of Azerbaijan for 2020-2025 is prepared 7) Document is completed 8) Information accessibility and capacity development of the Ministry is ensured 9) Awareness and basic capacities for improved access to information and government data have increased 10) Group is formed 11) Data is formed 12) Number of participants attending 13) Report is published 14) Open Forums are organized 15) Group is formed 16) Document is completed 17) Relations are set 18) Initial steps for collaboration is established 19) Preparations for the first Innovation Festival is in place 20) Reserve Data Center in Yevlakh, Azerbaijan is launched 21) SHA2 Certificate Services Center in the Data Processing Center (DPC) within MTCHT is established

comment.narrative: 1)Lack of Youth IGF Secretariat in Baku 2)Similar event content has never been analyzed 3) Second Youth IGF should be organized 4) No similar platform was initiated 5) Evolving of High Technologies via Artificial Intelligence, Cloud Technologies, Robopark initiative and human capital by envisioning potential opportunities are needed 6) National Strategy on High Technologies of Azerbaijan for 2020-2025 should be prepared, there is a need for a relevant document since we have prepared previous two relevant strategies via the joint project 7) No such inclusive document has ever 8) There is a good national capacity but it is limited 9) Essential preparation and strong local and international involvement is required 10) Strong local capacity is in place for the successful implementation of the event 11) Completely new and contemporary content need to be constructed 12) Convening of the 7th Regional Internet Governance Forum in Azerbaijan is required 13) The comprehensive report is needed 14) No active participation at the latest forums 15) Strong local capacity is in place for the successful implementation of the output 16) No such inclusive document has ever been carried out 17) There is no close affairs with other Smart Cities 18) No existing network of experts 19) Further expansion of the Idea to Business (I2B) initiative is required 20) Establishment of the Reserve Data Center in Yevlakh, Azerbaijan is necessary 21) SHA2 Certificate Services Center in the Data Processing Center (DPC) within MTCHT should be established

Activity 1. Initiating and building capacity of the Youth Internet Governance Forum in Azerbaijan. Activity 2. Electing the potency of the TASIM project, envisioning potential business opportunities and supporting partnership appliances. Activity 3. Capacity building for the development of the Ministry of Transport, Communications and High Technologies and the advancement of the existing communication infrastructures. Activity 4. Convening of the 6th Regional Internet Governance Forum in Azerbaijan. Activity 5. Developing Smart City Road Map for Baku, Azerbaijan. Activity 6. Evolving National Concept and innovative frameworks for digital economy development.

1) Negotiations were conducted with Internet Governance Forum Secretariat in Geneva regarding the establishment of the Youth IGF Forum Secretariat Azerbaijan within IGF 2018. The possibility of engaging additional stakeholders for the establishment of the Youth IGF Forum Secretariat Azerbaijan and submit proposals regarding this case to the MTCHT were explored. Website and logo of Youth IGF Azerbaijan were developed. Based on the decision at the steering committee meeting the event will take place in 2019. 2) Due to prolonged duration of second implementation stage of TASIM initiative there we no actions regarding this output for 2018. Based on the decision at the steering committee meeting this initiative will be taken out from the project activities. 3) Procurement of mobile signature server for Data Processing Centre of MTCHT was successfully processed - Request for quotation was announced on July 31, 2018 and the contract in the amount of 85 000 USD was signed with the winning vendor, IT SYSTEM SOLUTIONS LLC, on September 15, 2018. Prior 15% instalment (12 250 USD) was made on October 24, 2018 due to the late money transfer from the Ministry. The final (85%) transfer in the amount of 72 750 USD was made on December 14, 2018. Two latest Apple Monoblocks were purchased for the ministry within framework of the capacity development in innovation, particularly for the jointly organized Idea to Business contests– Micro purchasing process was made on September 13, 2018 and the vendor offering the lowest price was ASBC LLC with 5674 AZN. 4) Project Manager and Project Director successfully participated at the Global IGF 2018 in Paris France 12-14 November 2018. “Working together at the regional level – projects & forums” open forum was organized within IGF 2018 (35 men; 22 women). The 6th RIGFAZ was promoted via Azerbaijani Booth within the framework of IGF 2018 Village. The relevant event was promoted through social media (Facebook and Instagram). The event itself was postponed in order to convene it during CyberWeek February/March 2019. 5) International practises regarding smart city building were analysed. Road Map on Smart City development in Azerbaijan is on the final phase. Shamakhi was selected as a pilot city. 6) Innovation Road Map Presentation within the framework of Innoweek 2018 where 4 reports written by Mr. Edward Roche for the project on innovations were presented at the Heydar Aliyev Center, and during the event Guest Participant Ms. Andrea Boyle made presentation regarding smart city development. Number of participants 250 (180 men; 70 women). Idea to Business contest was convened together with MTCHT in the regions of Azerbaijan (Shaki, Sumgait, Ganja and Nakhchivan) and Universities of Baku whore than 100 participants per event (approx. 60 men; 40 women per event). Grand Final of Idea to Business was organized in Baku at Heydar Aliyev Center dated 26 October 26, 2018. Number of Participants 300 (220 men; 80 women). InnoCamp in Shaki, Azerbaijan was organized together with MTCHT dated 29 September 2018. Number of participants 150 (110 men; 40 women). Equipment for Robotech Lab initiative was procured within project for the MTCHT dated 30 August 2018 - 5679 USD. Robotech Lab opening and further functioning at School N23 were organized dated 16 November 2018.

1) First Youth IGF is organized. All event info is ready. Event is organized. Platform is operational 2) Artificial Intelligence experts and resources are properly institutionalized Establish the database of Azerbaijani experts in Cloud Technologies all over the world in order to conduct detailed assessment on current situation and case studies, as well as required infrastructural advancement spots. Establishment of the “Robopark” robot technology lab and Robotech Cluster of companies within ICT Lab of the MTCHT National Strategy on High Technologies of Azerbaijan for 2020-2025 is completed. 3) Document is completed. Information accessibility and capacity development of the Ministry is ensured. Awareness and basic capacities for improved access to information and government data have increased. 4) Group is formed. Data is formed. Number of participants attending at the 6th Regional Internet Governance Forum Report is published. Open Forums are organized 5) Announcement for the hiring of international expert was launched in December 2019. Document is completed. Relations are set. 6) Initial steps for collaboration is established. Preparations for the first Innovation Festival is in place. Preparations for the establishment of the Incubation Centers at the Ministry. 7) Advertising I2B must be broadly in the local social media and through the internet. Preparing recommendations on effective investment conditions and special venture investment rules for supporting relevant sector. Engaging international experts via inquired procurement processes 8) Raise awareness of population, telecommunication operators, businesses, and IT companies in the republic and the region on the usage of Reserve Data Center in Yevlakh. Develop an Action Plan of management and operation of the Reserve Data Center in Yevlakh. 9) Strengthen the capacity of the Government to enhance professionalism, responsibility and privileges in the public sector via procurement of the SHA2. Enhance efficiency and quality of services provided by the governmental authorities, as well as the governance mechanisms of the state via the MTCHT

1) Event and Alumni Team are fully operational. Post event activities are conducted. Post event deliverables are ready. New perspectives are identified. 2) Roster is established. The seminars regarding the outcomes of the evaluation of the perspectives in order to improve literacy on innovative technologies were convened. Structuring of similar “Robopark” robot technology labs in Shamakhi and PirAllahi regions of Azerbaijan is scheduled for 2020. The outlook of the relevant document is implemented for 2020 3) Number of recommendations implemented. Relevant ministerial infrastructure is upgraded.Improvement of Azerbaijan’s status. 4) Group’s discussions are ongoing. New tendencies are reviewed. Number of positive feedbacks received. Reports is disseminated. New contacts are set. 5) Procurement processes are ongoing. Number of proposals evaluated. Cooperation is realized and document will be prepared in 2020. 6) The network of experts is involved in a continuous and mutual collaboration. First Innovation Festival is organized. At least one Incubation Centers is established at the Ministry. 7) All regional events successfully implemented. Venue infrastructure delivered ready on time as well as proper deliver of the operational requirements and logistics review. Post event activities and comprehensive event report were presented to the stakeholders 8) Specifications for procurement of equipment for establishment of the Reserve Data Center in Yevlakh was prepared and relevant tender processes were conducted 9) Prepare specifications for procurement of SHA2 Certificate Services Center in order to ensure improved and advanced information accessibility, information sharing and partnership and announce the tender for 2020

1) Second Youth IGF is organized, All event info is ready, Event is organized, Platform is operational 2) Artificial Intelligence experts and resources are properly institutionalized Establish the spots Establishment of the “Robopark” robot technology lab and Robotech Cluster of companies within ICT Lab of the MTCHT National Strategy on High Technologies of Azerbaijan for 2020-2025 is completed 3) Document is completed Information accessibility and capacity development of the Ministry is ensured Awareness and basic capacities for improved access to information and government data have telecommunication operators, businesses, and IT companies in the republic and the region on the usage of Reserve Data Center in Yevlakh Develop an Action Plan of management and operation of the Reserve Data Center in Yevlakh 9) Strengthen the capacity of the Government to enhance professionalism, responsibility and privileges in the public sector via procurement of the SHA2 Enhance efficiency and quality of services provided by the governmental authorities, as well as the governance mechanisms of the state via the MTCHT

1) Event and Alumni Team are fully operational, New perspectives are identified, Due to Covid-19 pandemic event was cancelled 2) Roster is established The seminars regarding the outcomes of the evaluation of the perspectives in order to improve literacy on innovative technologies were convened Three project experts were hired in order to develop an Azerbaijani speech recognition system speech patterns and its transcript. 3) Number of recommendations implemented, Relevant ministerial infrastructure is upgraded,Improvement of Azerbaijan’s status 4) Group’s discussions are ongoing New tendencies are reviewed Number of positive feedbacks received Reports is disseminated New contacts are set Event was postponed due to global Covid-19 pandemic 5) Cooperation with several the ministry and un agencies is realized and the comprehensive document is planned to be prepared in 2021. 6) The network of experts is involved in a continuous and mutual collaboration First Innovation Online Innoweek is organized 7) All regional on-site events were postponed due Covid-19 pandemic. Online platform was developed in order to handle the ease access of interested parties. Post event activities and comprehensive event report and plan for 2021 were presented to the stakeholders 8) Evaluation for procurement of equipment for establishment of the Reserve Data Center in Yevlakh was prepared and relevant tender processes were conducted Tender was successfully conducted. 9) Prepare technical specification specifications for procurement of SHA2 Certificate Services Center in order to ensure improved and advanced information accessibility, information sharing and partnership and announce the tender for 2021. International expert was hired to assist the project team in technical issues.
